title: Ticket #5834: fix misleading message "Request has not yet been considered by the ma"
description:
When running "condor_q -analyze", the message "Request has not yet been considered by the matchmaker" is always, or almost always, there, even when that is actually not correct. Seems to be some sort of legacy message. But it is misleading. Can that be fixed?

Cheers, Jose
remarks:
2016-Aug-08 11:27:47 by bbockelm:
I believe the schedd used to mark jobs as considered by the negotiator before resource request lists were implemented.

It might be possible to look at all the jobs in a RRL and mark them as considered when there's an explicit rejection message for one job in that RRL (however, that might cause a significant amount of churn in the job log!).

Alternately, we can just rip the code that prints out this warning in condor_q -analyze.

2020-Jan-07 11:05:38 by tannenba:
LIGO has requested the same thing, tagging as LIGO group ticket for now

2020-Jul-21 12:10:31 by tlmiller:
Resolving this ticket, but leaving #7530 open as a place-holder for future improvements.
check_ins:
2020-Jul-21 12:09   Check-in [60173]: (#5834) Release note. (By Todd L Miller )
2020-Jul-21 11:58   Check-in [60171]: (#5834, #7530) Remove 'Job has not yet been considered by the matchmaker.' as almost always wrong and almost never useful. (By Todd L Miller )
creator: jcaballero
